ReviewList.Text: One of the best books on the subject. Reads amazingly well.
Really cool book. Links philosophy and quantum physics which is exactly what I was looking for. Easy to read and understand. Good for someone new to quantum physics.

I found this book very enjoyable and a good mental reflection toward the Truth from a different angle then I'm used to. The best anyone can do is to reflect, or point, toward the Truth and Tomaj does a good job of it. I'm not convinced about how important we are to the whole show yet, but I'm still seeking. I do know that this isn't the only show in town, "My Father's (that is Consciousness's) house has many mansions."...and that picture wasn't pointed at, but "Good" book!
This Scientist/Mystic has a wonderful depth of understanding about the basic unity of science and religion! Excellent read!

I've given this thought-provoking book five stars because it engaged me, made me think wild thoughts, and chuckle at where it lead. As already said, the author makes intriguing comparisons (between quantum physics, ancient religious writings, and transcendental phenomenology) that invite you to look into these things further. A fun read!

I follow Advaita Siddhanta.  I flunked physics in high school.  This book is brilliant.  It reconciles ancient Vedic philosophy with the Upanishads and modern science.  I study Ramana Maharishi and Satguru Sivaya Subramuniyaswami and Wu Hsin and this book connects it all so that I can understand it and the concept of maya. An incredible find.  When the student is ready the teachings appear.  Aum Namah Sivaya
